Utilities

Layouts

Below is a reference of all the layouts available for pages within the website.

Icons

  1. Icons
  2. Icons with labels
  3. Icon classes
  4. Icon sizes

The sprite sheet contains the following icons for use in the website. Combine the icons with Modulifier & Typografier classes for lots of variability.

Icons

Icons with labels

Sample code for using SVG icon spritesheets mixed with a text label, using the below classes.

<a class="icon-link exa" href="#">
  <i class="icon i-1">
    <svg><use xlink:href="/images/icons.svg#icon-id"></use></svg>
  </i>
  <span class="icon-label">Icon label</span>
</a>

Icon classes

Classes that can be used on elements & combined to make nicely aligned icons and labels.

Icon sizes

Icons sizes available from Modulifier & Typografier.

Typography

  1. Size adjustments
  2. Vertical spacing
  3. Horizontal spacing
  4. Font sizes
  5. Headings
  6. Links
  7. Lists
  8. Quotations
  9. Emphasis & edits
  10. Typesetting
  11. Utility classes

The modular typography uses a system generated by Typografier. There are multiple sizes and spacing classes available—all based on the font-size and line-height to create a harmonious vertical rhythm.

Size adjustments

Typografier generates font-sizes and line-heights for different screen widths that are more appropriate for the available space.

Vertical spacing

The vertical spacing classes generated by Typografier provide a range of different sizes for both top & bottom padding and bottom margins. These same sizes would be applied to the island classes.

Horizontal spacing

The horizontal spacing classes generated by Typografier provide range of different sizes for left & right padding. These same sizes would be applied to the island classes.

Font sizes

There are multiple font-sizes available based on a typographic scale. The font-sizes and line-heights increase as the screen gets wider to better use the available space.

Headings

Links

Lists

Quotations

Emphasis & edits

Typesetting

Utility classes

Modules

  1. Images & embed containers
  2. Media objects
  3. Skip links
  4. Utility classes

Modulifier generates a series of simple, default CSS components that can be used throughout the site, or as basic building blocks for more complex patterns.

Images & embed containers

Embed containers should be used for all content images, enforcing aspect ratios but also giving browsers a placeholder for the graphic before it loads to prevent unnecessary text reflows.

<div class="embed embed-4by3">
  <img class="embed-item" src="/images/4by3.jpg" alt="">
</div>

Media objects

A simple pattern that provides and image beside some text—good for comments with avatars and many other situations. Will usually be combined into larger patterns.

<div class="media">
  <div class="media-img">
    <img src="/images/square.jpg" alt="">
  </div>
  <div class="media-body">
    <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit.</p>
  </div>
</div>

Skip links

A helpful accessibility feature that should be included immediately within the <body> tag on the top of most pages.

<ul class="skip-links">
  <li><a href="#main">Jump to main content</a></li>
  <li><a href="#nav">Jump to main navigation</a></li>
  <li><a href="#pause">Pause all animations</a></li>
</ul>

Utility classes

All the different utility classes available from within Modulifier.

Grid

  1. Grid sizes
  2. Utility classes

The grids generated by Gridifier provide an array of sizing options—with explicit classes—for each major breakpoint.

Grid sizes

Utility classes

Mix & match classes for grids and units to make any responsive layout necessary for templates.

Footer

To be used once per page to provide copyright and contact info

{% pattern footer/footer %}

Sections

  1. Project Brief
  2. text and image
  3. text and image inline at medium and large sizes
  4. subheader and text inline at medium and large sizes
  5. See More Work

To help separate content into their own categories

Project Brief

Use this layout for the project brief and description

{% pattern sections/project-brief title="Subheader" details="a brief description" aria-details="Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element" aria-label="Assign the description of an element to other elements on the page" alt-text="Assign the description to an image if necessary" mock-up="/images/3by2.png" image="/images/placeholder-1by1.svg" %}
Field name Data type Example
title required string "Subheader"
details required string "a brief description"
aria-details required string "Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element"
aria-label required string "Assign the description of an element to other elements on the page"
alt-text required string "Assign the description to an image if necessary"
mock-up required url /images/3by2.png
image required url /images/placeholder-1by1.svg

text and image

Use this type of card for image accompanying text

{% pattern sections/text-and-image title="Subheader" details="A short description" aria-details="Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element" aria-label="Assign the description of an element to other elements on the page" alt-text="Assign the description to an image if necessary" %}
Field name Data type Example
title required string "Subheader"
details required string "A short description"
aria-details required string "Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element"
aria-label required string "Assign the description of an element to other elements on the page"
alt-text required string "Assign the description to an image if necessary"

Field name Data type Example

See More Work

Use this for the bottom of the accompanying pages to redirect to work section

{% pattern sections/see-more title="See More Work" aria-details="Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element" aria-label="Assign the description of an element to other elements on the page" alt-text="Assign the description to an image if necessary" %}
Field name Data type Example
title required string "See More Work"
image required url
aria-details required string "Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element"
aria-label required string "Assign the description of an element to other elements on the page"
alt-text required string "Assign the description to an image if necessary"

Buttons

  1. Basic
  2. Ghost
  3. Light
  4. Send Form

Buttons should be used in situations where a dramatic, obvious action is require. Try not to over use buttons because they should be the primary call-to-action for a screen.

Basic

Default to using the basic button. It should always be used in front of light backgrounds.

{% pattern buttons/basic text="hola" url="/products/" %}
Field name Data type Example
text required string "hola"
url required url /products/

Ghost

The ghost button is specifically for banners, where it will be placed in front of busy images.

{% pattern buttons/ghost text="hello" url="/products/" %}
Field name Data type Example
text required string "hello"
url required url /products/

Light

The light button is for dark backgrounds, where it will be used instead of the basic button.

{% pattern buttons/light text="hello" url="/products/" %}
Field name Data type Example
text required string "hello"
url required url /products/

Send Form

Use this button at the end of any forms

{% pattern buttons/form-btn text="Submit" url="/products/" %}
Field name Data type Example
text required string "Submit"
url required url /products/

Image Sizes

  1. Image Flex
  2. 1by1
  3. image2by3
  4. image3by1
  5. image3by2
  6. 4by3
  7. 16x9

If you want the full photo, resize it to the same dimensions as the placeholder, otherwise it will be cut off

Image Flex

Use this for images that don’t fit into a specific ratio

{% pattern images/img-flex image="/images/2by3.png" aria-details="Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element" alt-text="Assign the description to an image if necessary" %}
Field name Data type Example
image required url /images/2by3.png
aria-details required string "Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element"
alt-text required string "Assign the description to an image if necessary"

1by1

Use this type for square images

{% pattern images/image1by1 image="/images/placeholder-1by1.svg" aria-details="Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element" alt-text="Assign the description to an image if necessary" %}
Field name Data type Example
image required url /images/placeholder-1by1.svg
aria-details required string "Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element"
alt-text required string "Assign the description to an image if necessary"

alt-text required string "Assign the description to an image if necessary"

image3by1

{% pattern images/image3by1 image="/images/3by2.png" aria-details="Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element" alt-text="Assign the description to an image if necessary" %}
Field name Data type Example
image required url /images/3by2.png
aria-details required string "Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element"
alt-text required string "Assign the description to an image if necessary"

image3by2

Use this type for landscape images

Cards

  1. figure with caption
  2. Image Card

The form can be used when creating a product description. Use corresponding icon with product description

figure with caption

Use this type of card for products

{% pattern cards/figure title="Figure header" details="Figure description" image="/images/placeholder-1by1.svg" aria-details="Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element" aria-label="Assign the description of an element to other elements on the page" alt-text="Assign the description to an image if necessary" %}
Field name Data type Example
title required string "Figure header"
details required string "Figure description"
image required url /images/placeholder-1by1.svg
aria-details required string "Assign non-visible text to enhance the description of an element"
aria-label required string "Assign the description of an element to other elements on the page"
alt-text required string "Assign the description to an image if necessary"

Header

Banner

  1. Main
  2. Illustration
  3. hero
  4. 404

Use for call to action and hero banners

Main

Use this banner for the home page

{% pattern banner/main-banner heading="Cap Libecap" text="Graphic Design" banner_img="/images/home-banner.jpg" %}
Field name Data type Example
heading required string "Cap Libecap"
text required string "Graphic Design"
button_text string "contact"
button_url url /products/
banner_img required url /images/home-banner.jpg

Illustration

Use this banner instead of a background image banner

{% pattern banner/image-banner heading="Cap Libecap" text="Graphic Design" %}
Field name Data type Example
heading required string "Cap Libecap"
text required string "Graphic Design"
button_text string "contact"
button_url url /products/

hero

Use this banner for secondary page. it is slightly shorter to show the content below

{% pattern banner/hero-banner heading="Cap Libecap" text="Graphic Design" banner_img="/images/about.jpg" %}
Field name Data type Example
heading required string "Cap Libecap"
text required string "Graphic Design"
button_text string "contact"
button_url url /products/
banner_img required url /images/about.jpg

404

Use this banner for the 404 page.

{% pattern banner/404-banner heading="Cap Libecap" text="Graphic Design" banner_img="/images/ruben.jpg" %}
Field name Data type Example
heading required string "Cap Libecap"
text required string "Graphic Design"
button_text string "contact"
button_url url /products/
banner_img required url /images/ruben.jpg
